body: Ideally this would be able to reach some of the events, so we can write code to respond to those events, but so far only the friend request event actually happens. --- This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/2234)

comment_data.body: With this you basically invalidate the existing fuzzer corpus. I like your idea to read until the end of the fuzzer stream.
good usecase for `std::min` if you want to clean that up
Why point at `data + size`? To trigger ASAN on read? How about a dedicated constructor for this case?
What is the benefit of this additional define here over `#ifdef` ing the code at the relevant places? IIRC this define has an ugly name on purpose, so that it's obvious which code is not fuzz tested.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -8,11 +8,24 @@
 #ifndef C_TOXCORE_TOXCORE_CCOMPAT_H
 #define C_TOXCORE_TOXCORE_CCOMPAT_H
 
+#include <stdbool.h> // bool, false, true
 #include <stddef.h>  // NULL, size_t
 
 #include "attributes.h"
 
-/* No declarations here. */
+#ifdef __cplusplus
+extern "C" {
+#endif
+
+#ifdef FUZZING_BUILD_MODE_UNSAFE_FOR_PRODUCTION

comment_data.body: Because semantically, we create one Fuzz_Data and then consume all of its input, which results in this. I can write that explicitly instead I guess.
Changed it, please take a look.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -8,11 +8,24 @@

 #define C_TOXCORE_TOXCORE_CCOMPAT_H
 
+#include <stdbool.h> // bool, false, true
 #include <stddef.h>  // NULL, size_t
 
 #include "attributes.h"
 
-/* No declarations here. */
+#ifdef __cplusplus
+extern "C" {
+#endif
+
+#ifdef FUZZING_BUILD_MODE_UNSAFE_FOR_PRODUCTION

comment_data.body: makes sense, it's just a bit confusing because the order is reversed in this code.
Done :). I did the one at the top of the file and missed this one.

The limiting factor for friend request events might be that the amount of fuzzing data that is generated is limited to 4KB currently. That's not many network packets. You might want to increase that.

> The limiting factor for friend request events might be that the amount of fuzzing data that is generated is limited to 4KB currently. That's not many network packets. You might want to increase that.

Trying that now, I'm running it with `-max_len=32768`.

`SUMMARY: AddressSanitizer: stack-overflow /proc/self/cwd/c-toxcore/toxcore/DHT.c:1086:5 in handle_data_search_response`

Didn't reach a callback, but found something that killed toxcore. I'll investigate tomorrow.

commit.message:
test: Add more functionality to the bootstrap harness.

Ideally this would be able to reach some of the events, so we can write
code to respond to those events, but so far only the friend request
event actually happens.

test: Add more functionality to the bootstrap harness.

Ideally this would be able to reach some of the events, so we can write
code to respond to those events, but so far only the friend request
event actually happens.

labels.description: Adding missing tests, refactoring tests; no production code change
labels.name: test

title: test: Add more functionality to the bootstrap fuzz harness.
